an3.12:4.1: “An anointed king should commemorate three places as long as he lives.
an3.12:5.1: The place he was anointed as king.
an3.12:6.1: The place where he won victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
an3.12:6.3: These are the three places an anointed king should commemorate as long as he lives.
an3.12:7.1: So too, a mendicant should commemorate three places as long as they live.
an3.12:7.3: The place where the mendicant shaved off their hair and beard, put on the ochre robes, and went forth from the lay life into homelessness.
an3.12:8.1: The place where the mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an3.12:9.1: The place where the mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
an3.12:9.3: These are the three places a mendicant should commemorate as long as they live.”
